WorkItem.Description:
How about adding another "comparison view" similar to the "Current Gear/Enchants/Buffs" one that shows how to acquire each of the items you currently have equipped?  Basically a sorted shopping list you could save to a file (and perhaps print):
 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Character Name/Level
Talent Build Name(n/0/0)
Date Time
Overall DPS/Survivability/etc
 
Item Name   Location/Boss/Price    Drop Rate  DPS/Survivability/etc 
 
<sorted list of currently equipped items>
 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

Comments.Message:
The Currently equipped items are the items you should have on/in the bank. Need instructions on how to open your bank? :-)

Rawr should be used as follows (go check the video tour for more details):
You should be marking all available item you have (bank/bags/equipped). 
Then run the optimiser to show you the best combo of your current gear. 
Then you build an upgrade list, which contains your "shopping list" of gear your should be looking to acquire.
Feel free to export that.

The Currently equipped items are the items you should have on/in the bank. Need instructions on how to open your bank? :-)

Rawr should be used as follows (go check the video tour for more details):
You should be marking all available item you have (bank/bags/equipped). 
Then run the optimiser to show you the best combo of your current gear. 
Then you build an upgrade list, which contains your "shopping list" of gear your should be looking to acquire.
Feel free to export that.

That's typically correct, wildebees, but it doesn't have to be that way. Many people do use entirely separate character files to build their target gear set, which is totally valid, as long as they understand how everything works. I'm sure tkb does know all that, as he's been around here for quite a while. :)

tkb, can you try the export to CSV, from the Current Gear/Enchants/Buffs list? Apart from including Buffs, is that the data you're looking for?
